intro: Hieracium umbraticola, commonly known as the shade hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium umbraticola is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
